statement.tex: \text{One kind of cake requires 200g of flour and}\\ \text{25g of fat, whereas another kind of cake}\\ \text{requires 100g of flour and 50g of fat. Find the}\\ \text{maximum number of cakes which can be made}\\ \text{from 5kg of flour and 1kg of fat, assuming}\\ \text{there is no shortage of other ingredients used}\\ \text{in baking the cakes.}

step.tex: \text{We need to maximise Total Cakes, }T(x, y),\\ \text{where } T(x, y) = x+y
\text{We need to maximise Total Cakes, }T(x, y),\\ \text{where } T(x, y) = 2x+y
step.reason: \text{To maximise the total number of cakes}\\ \text{simply add the number of cakes of each}\\ \text{kind}.

step.context: \text{What are the constraints on x and y,}\\ \text{the number cakes of each type?}
step.tex: \text{Less then 5kg of flour,}\\ \implies x\cdot 200(g)+y\cdot 100(g)\le 5000(g)\\ \implies 2x+y \le 50\\ \text{Less then 1kg of fat,}\\ \implies x\cdot 25(g)+y\cdot 50(g) \le 1000\\ \implies x+2y \le 40\\ \text{Quantity of cakes positive,}\\ \implies x\ge 0,\, y\ge 0

step.reason: \text{Each of cake types require both flour}\\ \text{and fat.}
